page.title: 20EAST MEON PARISH
page.content: Long-time residents are quick to point out that the eastern half of the area is within the parish of East Meon and comes under the District Council of Petersfield, whereas West Meon is administered from Winchester. Just inside the boundary is Westbury Park, part of an enormous barony at the time of the Domesday Book. The present House was built around the beginning of the 17th century, though extensively rebuilt after a fire in 1904. From 1926 until the late 1970's it housed a preparatory school. Now it is a nursing home with around 80 residents, providing some much needed employment. In the grounds is the ruin of St.Nicholas's Chapel, a 13th century building which was still intact in 1703, but which is now badly deteriorated.
